intro: Kali tragus subsp. ponticum, commonly known as the Pontic goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and bristly foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, sunny environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
